bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: boom chains obtained for use in tying boomsticks together to form a frame;
bundle and continuous wires obtained for use in securing logs that are transported within a frame;
swifter wires obtained for use in securing bundled logs to a frame.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Chemical substances, catalysts and direct agents

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: catalyst means a substance that produces or modifies a chemical reaction and that, at the end of the reaction, is unchanged;

direct agent means a substance that produces or modifies a chemical reaction and that is consumed in the chemical reaction to the point of destruction or dissipation or uselessness for any other purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), a chemical substance, catalyst or direct agent obtained for use

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in processing or manufacturing tangible personal property for sale or lease, and
to produce or modify a reaction that is essential for that processing or manufacturing

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part.
The exemption under subsection (2) does not apply to a chemical substance, catalyst or direct agent obtained

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for use to produce energy or as a source of energy, unless the chemical substance, catalyst or direct agent is electricity for use in an electrolytic process,

for use in processing tangible personal property, unless the processing consists of, is one step in or occurs immediately after a series of operations or a complex operation that results in a substantial change in the form or other physical or chemical characteristics of the tangible personal property,

for use to transform tangible personal property from a gaseous, liquid or solid state to another one of those states by means of the application of pressure or a change in temperature, unless the transformation is one step in, or occurs immediately after, an operation referred to in paragraph (b) of this subsection,
for use for the primary purpose of maintaining, lubricating or prolonging the life of machinery or equipment,
to be added to waste removed from the production process,
to be added to a tailings pond or settling pond,
for use for testing purposes, or

for use for the purpose of cleaning or sanitizing, unless the chemical substance, catalyst or direct agent is for use for the primary purpose of cleaning or sanitizing the tangible personal property referred to in subsection (2) (a).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The definition of "substantially" in section 1 [definitions] of the Act does not apply in subsection (3) (b) of this section.
Exothermic sleeves obtained for use in the casting of metal or metal alloys are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part.
Subsections (2) and (5) of this section are prescribed for the purposes of the following provisions of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 89 (2) [tax on acquisition of eligible tangible personal property];
section 90 (4) [tax on eligible tangible personal property brought into British Columbia];
section 99 (6) [tax on acquisition of exclusive product by independent sales contractor].

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Abrasives, dies, jigs, patterns and moulds

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, subject to subsection (2):

bcl:definition.bcl:text: die means a solid or hollow form used for shaping or marking goods in process by cutting, stamping, pressing or extruding, but does not include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: planers, saws, knives or blades, or
a die set or tap set used for cutting threads;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: grinding wheel means a disc or wheel

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the thickness of which does not exceed its diameter, and
that removes material by grinding,

bcl:definition.bcl:text: but does not include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a disc or wheel that removes material by cutting, or
a refiner plate or disc used for manufacturing pulp;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: jig means a device used in the accurate machining of goods in process to hold the goods firmly and guide the working tools, or to bend the goods in process;
mould means a hollow form

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: into which materials are placed to produce desired shapes, matrices or cavities, and
used to shape or form goods in process.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of the definitions in subsection (1), a die, grinding wheel, jig or mould does not include any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: components or materials used to manufacture or produce the die, grinding wheel, jig or mould;
any machinery, equipment or apparatus

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: to which the die, grinding wheel, jig or mould may be attached, or
that is necessary to carry out the function or process of the die, grinding wheel, jig or mould.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if obtained by a person for use in the manufacture, production, service or repair of tangible personal property or real property:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: abrasive paper, emery paper or other fabric-backed abrasives suitable for use by hand or for use with hand-held tools;
dies;
grinding wheels;
jigs;
moulds, other than moulds designed for use in food production;
patterns;
polishing wheels;
rotary steel brushes;
sand for use in sand blasting;
steel, plastic and glass shot and similar material for use in blasting clean a surface;
steel wool.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Moulds designed for use in food production are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if obtained by a person for use in the manufacture or production of food in the course of the person's business.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 117/2014, Sch. 4, s. 2.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Photographers and printers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Film, photographic paper and chemicals obtained for use in developing film are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if the film, photographic paper or chemicals are obtained

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by a person who is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a commercial photographer, or
in the business of photograph processing or finishing, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for use in the course of the person's business.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if obtained by printers or publishers for their own use in a printing or publishing process:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: artwork;
blankets and screens used in the printing process to transfer ink to the product being printed, but not including frames;
cuts;
engravings;
film;
flats;
negatives;
paste ups;
photoconductor drums;
photographs;
plates;
signatures;
slides;
transparencies;
typesetting products.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Materials obtained by printers or publishers for their own use in the manufacture or production of any of the items described in subsection (2) for their own use in a printing or publishing process are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part.
Subsections (1), (2) and (3) of this section are prescribed for the purposes of the following provisions of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 89 (2) [tax on acquisition of eligible tangible personal property];
section 90 (4) [tax on eligible tangible personal property brought into British Columbia];
section 99 (6) [tax on acquisition of exclusive product by independent sales contractor].

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prototypes

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 141 (1) (d) [exemptions in relation to software for prototypes] of the Act, Part 3 software that is not specifically designed for a prototype referred to in that provision is prescribed tangible personal property.

For the purposes of section 141 (1) (d) and (e) of the Act, making a copy of a prototype solely for the purpose of testing the prototype as part of the research and development activities referred to in the applicable provision is a prescribed purpose.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Ships' stores

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), ships' stores are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act if delivered to commercial vessels of more than 500 tons gross that normally operate in extraterritorial waters.
The exemption under subsection (1) does not apply to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: liquor, other than an alcohol-containing food product;
tobacco.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Bottles for milk products
bcl:section.bcl:text: Bottles are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if the bottles are

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: obtained for use to hold a milk product that is sold at a retail sale, and
returnable and reusable.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Animals and plants
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: living animals of a kind the products of which ordinarily constitute food for human consumption;
living plants and trees of a kind the products of which ordinarily constitute food for human consumption.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Feed

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, animal means an animal

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that is to be sold in the regular course of business, or
of a kind the products of which ordinarily constitute food for human consumption.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: feed obtained for use to feed an animal;
subject to subsection (2), grain, mill and other agricultural feeds and seeds obtained for use solely for an agricultural purpose;
vitamins and dietary supplements or adjuncts, in a form designed to be ingested orally, if the vitamins, supplements or adjuncts are obtained for consumption by an animal;

subject to subsection (3), drugs and medicines, including those in the form of salves, ointments, nasal sprays, inhalants, antiseptics, liniments, powders, germicides, laxatives, cough syrups and cold and flu remedies, that are

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: advertised or marketed as products for the treatment, mitigation or prevention of a disease or disorder in animals, and
obtained for use to treat an animal.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The exemption under subsection (1) (b) does not apply to grain, mill and other agricultural feeds and seeds that are obtained for use to feed

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a bird of a kind the products of which do not ordinarily constitute food for human consumption, or
a household pet.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The exemption under subsection (1) (d) does not apply to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: sunscreen;
oral hygiene products;
toiletries, shaving products, depilatories and fragrances;
soaps and moisturizers, unless the soap or moisturizer is medicated and is advertised or marketed as a product for the treatment, mitigation or prevention of a particular skin condition;
hair or fur products, unless the product is medicated and is advertised or marketed as a product for the treatment, mitigation or prevention of fleas, ticks or lice;
grooming products and cosmetics.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Farmers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, qualifying part means a part that is designed for use

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: as a replacement part for tangible personal property described in Schedule 2 [Tangible Personal Property for Farm Purpose], or
in the manufacture or repair of tangible personal property described in Schedule 2,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: but does not include a part that is suitable for use for any of the purposes referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) by reason only of the general nature of the part's design and manufacture.

Tangible personal property described in Schedule 2 is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Divisions 9 and 11 of that Part, if the tangible personal property is obtained by a qualifying farmer for use solely for a farm purpose.
A qualifying part is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the qualifying part is obtained by a qualifying farmer for use

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: as a replacement part for tangible personal property described in Schedule 2, or
in the manufacture or repair of tangible personal property described in Schedule 2, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the tangible personal property referred to in paragraph (a) (i) or (ii) is to be used by a qualifying farmer solely for a farm purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsections (2) and (3) of this section are prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (1) (a) [provisions providing exemptions in relation to tangible personal property] of the Act.

For the purposes of section 145 (1.1) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to tangible personal property or software] of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that tangible personal property is exempt under subsection (2) or (3) of this section, the collector is required to obtain

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name, address, card number and expiry date as recorded on a BC Farmer Identity Card issued to that person by the BC Agriculture Council, or
a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 30 (7) [evidence required to claim exemption in relation to tax payable in respect of vehicle] of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that a vehicle is exempt under subsection (2) of this section, the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia is required to obtain

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name, address, card number and expiry date as recorded on a BC Farmer Identity Card issued to that person by the BC Agriculture Council, or
a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Fertilizer and other materials

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, fertilizer means a substance or mixture of substances that contains nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium or other plant nutrients and is substantially advertised or marketed as a plant food, but does not include substances or mixtures of substances that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: contain 50 percent or more by volume of sand, gravel, topsoil, fill, weed control chemicals, fungicides or a substance that is not a plant nutrient, or any combination of them, or
are registered under the Pest Control Products Act (Canada).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following tangible personal property is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act if the tangible personal property is obtained by an individual:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: agricultural lime;
fertilizer;
organic mulch;
organic substances if the substances are advertised or marketed as compost aids or compost accelerators;
peat, other than peat pellets and compostable pots made from peat;
plant hormones, microorganisms and enzymes, or a mixture of plant hormones, microorganisms or enzymes, if advertised or marketed as a plant regulator;
sphagnum;
wood ash or charcoal if the wood ash or charcoal is advertised or marketed as a soil amendment.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following tangible personal property is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if the tangible personal property is obtained by a person, other than an individual, for an agricultural purpose:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: agricultural lime;
fertilizer;
organic mulch;
organic substances if the substances are advertised or marketed as compost aids or compost accelerators;
peat, other than peat pellets and compostable pots made from peat;
plant hormones, microorganisms and enzymes, or a mixture of plant hormones, microbes or enzymes, if advertised or marketed as a plant regulator;
sphagnum;
wood ash or charcoal if the wood ash or charcoal is advertised or marketed as a soil amendment.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if obtained for use in landscaping or as bedding for animals:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: sawdust;
straw;
wood chips;
wood shavings.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following tangible personal property is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act if the tangible personal property is advertised or marketed as a growing medium for plants and is obtained by an individual:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: compostable basket liners and growing mats made only from organic materials;
compostable pots made only from organic materials;
diatomaceous earth;
humus;
orchid bark;
peat pellets;
perlite;
potting soil and soilless potting mix unless the soil or mix

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: contains 50 percent or more by volume of sand, gravel, topsoil, fill, weed control chemicals, fungicides or any combination of them, or
is registered under the Pest Control Products Act (Canada);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: vermiculite.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following tangible personal property is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if the tangible personal property is advertised or marketed as a growing medium for plants and is obtained by a person, other than an individual, for an agricultural purpose:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: compostable basket liners and growing mats made only from organic materials;
compostable pots made only from organic materials;
diatomaceous earth;
humus;
orchid bark;
peat pellets;
perlite;
potting soil and soilless potting mix unless the soil or mix

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: contains 50 percent or more by volume of sand, gravel, topsoil, fill, weed control chemicals, fungicides or any combination of them, or
is registered under the Pest Control Products Act (Canada);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: vermiculite.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Commercial fishers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, qualifying part means a part that is designed for use in the repair or reconditioning of a boat, fishing net or fishing equipment, but does not include a part that is suitable for use for either of those purposes by reason only of the general nature of the part's design and manufacture.

Boats, fishing nets and fishing equipment are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if the boat, fishing net or fishing equipment is obtained by a qualifying commercial fisher for use solely for a commercial fishing purpose.
A qualifying part is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the qualifying part is obtained by a qualifying commercial fisher for use in the repair or reconditioning of a boat, fishing net or fishing equipment, and
the boat, fishing net or fishing equipment referred to in paragraph (a) is to be used by a qualifying commercial fisher solely for a commercial fishing purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsections (2) and (3) of this section are prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (1) (a) [provisions providing exemptions in relation to tangible personal property] of the Act.

For the purposes of section 145 (1.1) (a) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to tangible personal property or software] of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that tangible personal property is exempt under subsection (2) or (3) of this section, the collector is required to obtain a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Aquaculturists

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, qualifying part means a part that is designed for use

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: as a replacement part for tangible personal property described in Schedule 4 [Tangible Personal Property for Aquaculture Purpose], or
in the repair of tangible personal property described in Schedule 4,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: but does not include a part that is suitable for use for either of the purposes referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) by reason only of the general nature of the part's design and manufacture.

Tangible personal property described in Schedule 4 is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if the tangible personal property is obtained by a qualifying aquaculturist for use solely for an aquaculture purpose.
A qualifying part is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the qualifying part is obtained by a qualifying aquaculturist for use

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: as a replacement part for tangible personal property described in Schedule 4, or
in the repair of tangible personal property described in Schedule 4, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the tangible personal property referred to in paragraph (a) (i) or (ii) is to be used by a qualifying aquaculturist solely for an aquaculture purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsections (2) and (3) of this section are prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (1) (a) [provisions providing exemptions in relation to tangible personal property] of the Act.

For the purposes of section 145 (1.1) (a) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to tangible personal property or software] of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that tangible personal property is exempt under subsection (2) or (3) of this section, the collector is required to obtain a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

For the purposes of section 30 (7) (a) [evidence required to claim exemption in relation to tax payable in respect of vehicle] of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that a vehicle is exempt under subsection (2) of this section, the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia is required to obtain a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Other Exemptions in Relation to Tangible Personal Property

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transfer due to dissolution of marriage or relationship
bcl:section.bcl:text: An individual is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act in respect of tangible personal property transferred to the individual from a spouse or former spouse of the individual under

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an agreement dividing property under Part 5 [Property Division] or 6 [Pension Division] of the Family Law Act,
a written separation agreement, or a marriage agreement, referred to in the Family Relations Act, or
an order of a court on the dissolution of a marriage or marriage-like relationship.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Poppies, wreaths and natural, cut Christmas trees
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Remembrance Day poppies and wreaths;
natural, cut evergreen trees sold as Christmas trees.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemptions in relation to food — liquor and food products containing cannabis not exempt

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, cannabis has the same meaning as in the Cannabis Control and Licensing Act but does not include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: industrial hemp within the meaning of the Industrial Hemp Regulations (Canada), or
a product that is exempt from the application of the Cannabis Act (Canada) under section 2 (2) of the Industrial Hemp Regulations (Canada).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 139 (a) [exclusions from exemptions in relation to food] of the Act, the following are prescribed as food products excluded from the exemption under that section:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: food products containing cannabis;
liquor, other than an alcohol-containing food product.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Dry ice
bcl:section.bcl:text: Dry ice is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Gold, silver or platinum
bcl:section.bcl:text: Gold, silver or platinum in the form of bullion or coin is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act unless the bullion or coin is obtained for a purchase price greater than the market value of its gold, silver or platinum content.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemptions in relation to transportation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, used zero-emission vehicle means a zero-emission vehicle that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: was previously purchased at a retail sale for a purpose other than for the purpose only of leasing the zero-emission vehicle to other persons, or
was previously leased by a person other than

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the lessee, or
a person who is exempt from tax under section 142 (2) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: non-motorized bicycles;
non-motorized tricycles, each wheel of which has a diameter of 350 mm or more;
electric bicycles and tricycles that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: have pedals or hand cranks that allow for the cycle to be propelled by human power,
have wheels that have a diameter of 350 mm or more,
have one or more electric motors that

bcl:clause.bcl:text: have continuous power output ratings that in total do not exceed 500 watts, and
are not capable of propelling the cycle at a speed greater than 32 km/hr on level ground,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: do not have a combustion engine, and
are not marketed as, or designed to have the appearance of, an electric motorcycle, an electric moped, an electric scooter or another similar device;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: kits for converting a device described in paragraph (a) or (b) into a device described in paragraph (b.1);
aircraft powered by a turbine, and parts for those aircraft;
aircraft that are not remotely piloted and that are powered solely by electricity, and parts for those aircraft;
self-propelled vessels of more than 500 tons gross;
subject to subsection (4), a used zero-emission vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following are exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: tangible personal property, other than an aircraft or a part for an aircraft, obtained by a person operating a commercial airline for use during the airline's interprovincial or international flights by

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the airline's passengers, or
the airline in serving its passengers;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: trailers obtained for use solely with multijurisdictional vehicles;
parts obtained for use in

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a multijurisdictional vehicle, or
a trailer referred to in paragraph (b).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (2) (b) and (c) of this section is prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (1) (a) [provisions providing exemptions in relation to tangible personal property] of the Act.
Subsection (1.1) (e) does not apply in respect of a used zero-emission vehicle in the following circumstances:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the used zero-emission vehicle was received as a gift and at the time the person received the gift the odometer reading was less than 6 000 km;

the used zero-emission vehicle was acquired at a sale in Canada that is not a taxable supply by a registrant under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act and at the time of sale the odometer reading was less than 6 000 km.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tangible personal property subject to security instrument

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, sale means a sale referred to in paragraph (g) of the definition of "sale" in section 1 [definitions] of the Act.
Tangible personal property repurchased at a sale is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the purchaser takes possession of the tangible personal property under a security instrument, and
tax was paid by the purchaser in respect of the previous purchase of the tangible personal property

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: under the Act, the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act or the Social Service Tax Act and the purchaser has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under those Acts, a refund of that tax, or

under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act, in respect of British Columbia as a participating province under Part IX of that Act, and the purchaser has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under Part IX of that Act, a refund of or a credit or rebate for that tax.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Parts

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a part designed and obtained for use to repair or recondition tangible personal property is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if the tangible personal property would be exempt from tax imposed under the Act if the tangible personal property were obtained on the date on which the part is obtained.

The exemption under subsection (1) does not apply to a part obtained for use to repair or recondition tangible personal property that would be exempt from tax under any of the following provisions of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 44 (1) [lease under sale and lease-back arrangement];
section 50 (4) [exemption from tax on registration of travel trailer brought into British Columbia];
section 52 (5) [exemption from tax respecting boat or travel trailer brought into British Columbia by non-residents].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The exemption under subsection (1) does not apply to a part obtained for use to repair or recondition tangible personal property that would be exempt from tax under any of the following provisions of this regulation:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 3 (1) (j) [clip-on sunglasses];
section 17.1 [gifts];
section 18 [gifts between family members];
section 19 [registered charities];
section 20 [prizes, draws and awards];
section 21 [inheritance of tangible personal property];
section 22 [new resident's effects — tangible personal property];
section 23 [vehicle, boat or aircraft brought into British Columbia for gift];
section 24 [vehicle purchased for use outside British Columbia];
section 25 [aircraft purchased for use outside British Columbia];
section 26 [tangible personal property shipped outside British Columbia];
section 30.1 [heat pumps];
section 32 (2) [air hoses designed to connect to respirators];
section 46 (2) [farmers];
section 48 (2) [commercial fishers];
section 49 (2) [aquaculturists];
section 50 [transfer due to dissolution of marriage or relationship];
section 55 (1.1) (e) [exemptions in relation to used zero-emission vehicles];
section 56 [tangible personal property subject to security instrument];
section 60.2 [purchases at duty free shop];
Part 5 [Production Machinery and Equipment];
Part 9 [Related Party Asset Transfers].

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Used manufactured buildings

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: previous purchaser means a person who purchased a manufactured building at a previous sale;
previous sale, in respect of a manufactured building referred to in subsection (2), means the retail sale, referred to in paragraph (a) (i) of that subsection, of the manufactured building.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A manufactured building is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the manufactured building was previously

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: sold at a retail sale, and
subject to subsection (3), used as a building by

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the previous purchaser of the manufactured building,
another person at the expense of the previous purchaser,
a principal for whom the previous purchaser acted as agent in acquiring the manufactured building at the previous sale, or
another person at the expense of a principal for whom that previous purchaser acted as agent in acquiring the manufactured building at the previous sale, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any of the following applies:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the manufactured building was designed and is obtained for residential use;
the previous sale took place before July 1, 2010;
tax was paid by the previous purchaser of the manufactured building in respect of the previous sale

bcl:clause.bcl:text: under the Act and the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under the Act, a refund of that tax, or

under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act, in respect of British Columbia as a participating province under Part IX of that Act, and that person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under Part IX of that Act, a refund of or a credit or rebate for that tax.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (2) (a) (ii), use of a manufactured building does not include leasing the manufactured building as a lessor.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Custom software, custom modified software and other software

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: custom modified software means software that is modified

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in a manner that involves changes to the source code, and
solely to meet the requirements of a specific person

bcl:definition.bcl:text: if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the purchase price or lease price, as applicable, is for the software as modified, and
that purchase price or lease price is greater than double what it would be for the software in its unmodified form;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: custom software means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: software that is developed solely to meet the requirements of a specific person, and
modifications to software referred to in paragraph (a), if the modifications are performed for that specific person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Custom software or custom modified software is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 9 of that Part, if the custom software or custom modified software is obtained by, or on behalf of, the specific person referred to in the definition of "custom software" or "custom modified software", as applicable, in subsection (1) of this section, for that specific person's own use.

Custom software or custom modified software is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act if the custom software or custom modified software is sold, as part of a business sold as a going concern, by a person who retains no rights or interests in the custom software or custom modified software.
Software is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the software is sold, as part of a business sold as a going concern, by a person who retains no rights or interests in the software,
before the sale referred to in paragraph (a), the software was modified

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in a manner that involved changes to the source code, and
solely to meet the requirements of a specific person, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the purchase price or lease price, as the case may be, of the modifications referred to in paragraph (b) was

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: segregated on the receipt, bill or invoice provided to the purchaser or lessee, and
greater than the purchase price or lease price, as the case may be, of the software in its unmodified form.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Software source code in non-executable form is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act.
Subsections (3) and (4) of this section are prescribed for the purposes of the following provisions of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 89 (2) [tax on acquisition of eligible tangible personal property];
section 90 (4) [tax on eligible tangible personal property brought into British Columbia];
section 99 (6) [tax on acquisition of exclusive product by independent sales contractor].

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Freedom of information and protection of privacy
bcl:section.bcl:text: Tangible personal property acquired under the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act and described in Schedule 1 [Schedule of Maximum Fees] of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act Regulation, B.C. Reg. 155/2012, is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Repealed
bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 117/2014, Sch. 4, s. 4.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Purchases at duty free shop
bcl:section.bcl:text: Tangible personal property is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act if the tangible personal property is purchased at a duty free shop, as defined in the Customs Act (Canada), by a person who is about to leave Canada.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Delivery charge for aggregate

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: aggregate means quarry material and fill ordinarily used in the construction and maintenance of civil and structural projects;
delivery charge means a charge included under section 10 (2) (e) (i) of the Act [original purchase price of tangible personal property] in the purchase price of tangible personal property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The portion of the purchase price of aggregate that is a delivery charge is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act if the purchaser is not required to pay the delivery charge in order to purchase the aggregate.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Purchases and leases on commercial vessels

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tangible personal property is exempt from tax imposed under Part 3 of the Act if the tangible personal property is purchased or leased

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on a passenger-carrying commercial vessel during the course of a scheduled sailing

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: from a port in British Columbia to a port outside British Columbia,
from a port outside British Columbia to a port in British Columbia, or
between ports outside British Columbia,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: from a person who has an established commercial presence in one or more areas on board the vessel, and
for use only during the course of the scheduled sailing.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person referred to in subsection (1) (b) is exempt from the requirement to levy and collect tax in the circumstances described in subsection (1) (a) and (b).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Repealed
bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 210/2022, s. (c).]

bcl:division.bcl:text: Evidence Relating to Exemptions under Act in Respect of Tangible Personal Property

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Evidence relating to exemption under section 44 (2) of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 44 (2) [evidence required to claim exemption if lease under sale and lease-back arrangement] of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that tangible personal property is exempt under section 44 (1) of the Act from tax imposed under Division 3 of Part 3 of the Act, the collector is required to obtain

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a document evidencing the purchase of the tangible personal property by that person, and
a document evidencing the payment of tax referred to in subparagraph (i), (ii) or (iii) of section 44 (1) (b) of the Act in respect of the tangible personal property by that person.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Evidence relating to exemption of natural gas under section 140 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 145 (1.1) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to tangible personal property or software] of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that natural gas, as defined in the Motor Fuel Tax Act, is exempt under section 140 [exemption in relation to fuel] of the Act, the collector is required to obtain a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Evidence relating to exemptions under section 141 (1) of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 145 (1.1) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to tangible personal property or software] of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that tangible personal property is exempt under section 141 (1) [exemptions in relation to industry and commerce] of the Act, the collector is required to obtain

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that person's registration number, or
if that person does not have a registration number, a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Evidence relating to exemptions under section 142 of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 145 (1.1) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to tangible personal property or software] of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that tangible personal property is exempt under section 142 [exemptions for tangible personal property intended for lease] of the Act, the collector is required to obtain

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that person's registration number, or
if that person does not have a registration number, a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Software obtained by qualifying school, school board or similar authority

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), software is exempt from tax imposed under Part 4 of the Act, other than section 109 of that Part, if the software is obtained by a qualifying school, school board or similar authority for use substantially as a teaching aid for students.
The exemption under subsection (1) does not apply to software obtained for use by teachers to assess or evaluate students or to report on students' progress.
Subsection (1) of this section is prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (1) (b) [provisions providing exemptions in relation to software] of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: New resident's effects — software

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Software is exempt from tax imposed under section 106 [tax on use of software on device in British Columbia] of the Act if the software was purchased by an individual

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for use solely for a non-business purpose, and
at least 30 days before the individual became a resident of British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Software that qualified for an exemption under subsection (1) on the date on which the software was first used in British Columbia and that is subsequently used for a business purpose is exempt from tax imposed under section 109 [tax if use of software changes] of the Act if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the use of the software for a business purpose does not begin within the first 6 months after the individual referred to in subsection (1) of this section became a resident of British Columbia,
the software was owned and used by that individual for more than 3 years before that individual became a resident of British Columbia, and
the individual referred to in subsection (1)

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: previously paid tax under the Act or the Social Service Tax Act in respect of the software and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under those Acts, a refund of that tax,

previously paid tax under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act in respect of the software and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under Part IX of that Act, a refund of or a credit or rebate for that tax, or
previously paid sales tax in respect of the software to another province and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund of or a credit or rebate for that sales tax.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Commercial fishers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Software designed for use on electronic monitoring equipment described in item 22 of Schedule 3 [Fishing Equipment for Commercial Fishing Purpose] is exempt from tax imposed under Part 4 of the Act, other than section 109 of that Part, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the software is obtained by a qualifying commercial fisher for use on electronic monitoring equipment described in item 22 of Schedule 3, and
the electronic monitoring equipment is to be used by a qualifying commercial fisher solely for a commercial fishing purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) of this section is prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (1) (b) [provisions providing exemptions in relation to software] of the Act.

For the purposes of section 145 (1.1) (a) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to tangible personal property or software] of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that software is exempt under subsection (1) of this section, the collector is required to obtain a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transfer due to dissolution of marriage or relationship
bcl:section.bcl:text: An individual is exempt from tax imposed under Part 4 of the Act in respect of software transferred to the individual from a spouse or former spouse of the individual under

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an agreement dividing property under Part 5 [Property Division] or 6 [Pension Division] of the Family Law Act,
a written separation agreement, or a marriage agreement, referred to in the Family Relations Act, or
an order of a court on the dissolution of a marriage or marriage-like relationship.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Custom software, custom modified software and other software

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: custom modified software means software that is modified

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in a manner that involves changes to the source code, and
solely to meet the requirements of a specific person

bcl:definition.bcl:text: if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the purchase price is for the software as modified, and
that purchase price is greater than double what it would be for the software in its unmodified form;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: custom software means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: software that is developed solely to meet the requirements of a specific person, and
modifications to software referred to in paragraph (a), if the modifications are performed for that specific person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Custom software or custom modified software is exempt from tax imposed under Part 4 of the Act, other than section 109 of that Part, if the custom software or custom modified software is obtained by, or on behalf of, the specific person referred to in the definition of "custom software" or "custom modified software", as applicable, in subsection (1) of this section, for that specific person's own use.

Custom software or custom modified software is exempt from tax imposed under Part 4 of the Act if the custom software or custom modified software is sold, as part of a business sold as a going concern, by a person who retains no rights or interests in the custom software or custom modified software.
Software is exempt from tax imposed under Part 4 of the Act if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the software is sold, as part of a business sold as a going concern, by a person who retains no rights or interests in the software,
before the sale referred to in paragraph (a), the software was modified

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in a manner that involved changes to the source code, and
solely to meet the requirements of a specific person, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the purchase price or lease price, as the case may be, of the modifications referred to in paragraph (b) was

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: segregated on the receipt, bill or invoice provided to the purchaser or lessee, and
greater than the purchase price or lease price, as the case may be, of the software in its unmodified form.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Software source code in non-executable form is exempt from tax imposed under Part 4 of the Act.
Subsections (3) and (4) of this section are prescribed for the purposes of section 112 (2) [tax on purchase of software by small seller] of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Software purchased by First Nation individual or band

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Software is exempt from tax imposed under Part 4 of the Act if the software is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: purchased by a First Nation individual or a band, and
for use on or with an electronic device that is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: owned or leased by the First Nation individual or band, and
ordinarily situated on First Nation land.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) of this section is prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (1) (b) [provisions providing exemptions in relation to software] of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Software incorporated into prototypes
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 113 (1) (d) [exemptions in relation to software for prototypes] of the Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: software that is not specifically designed for a prototype referred to in that provision is prescribed software, and
making a copy of a prototype solely for the purpose of testing the prototype as part of the research and development activities referred to in that provision is a prescribed purpose.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Evidence Relating to Exemptions under Act in Respect of Software

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Evidence relating to exemptions under section 113 (1) of Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 145 (1.1) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to tangible personal property or software] of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that software is exempt under section 113 (1) [exemptions in relation to software] of the Act, the collector is required to obtain

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that person's registration number, or
if that person does not have a registration number, a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Motor vehicle conversion for individuals with disabilities
bcl:section.bcl:text: A purchaser to whom section 116 [tax if contract for property conversion related to purchase] of the Act applies is exempt from tax imposed under that section if the processing, fabrication, manufacturing, attachment or incorporation referred to in subsection (2) (b) of that section is solely for the purpose of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: modifying a motor vehicle, other than a multijurisdictional vehicle, to facilitate the use of the vehicle by, or the transportation of, an individual using a wheelchair, or
equipping a motor vehicle, other than a multijurisdictional vehicle, with an auxiliary driving control to facilitate the operation of the vehicle by an individual with a disability.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Motor vehicle modification for individuals with disabilities
bcl:section.bcl:text: A purchaser to whom section 117 [tax if contract for modification of purchased property] of the Act applies is exempt from tax imposed under that section if the modification or processing of the tangible personal property referred to in subsection (2) (b) of that section is solely for the purpose of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: modifying a motor vehicle, other than a multijurisdictional vehicle, to facilitate the use of the vehicle by, or the transportation of, an individual using a wheelchair, or
equipping a motor vehicle, other than a multijurisdictional vehicle, with an auxiliary driving control to facilitate the operation of the vehicle by an individual with a disability.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: First Nation individual or band

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A purchaser is exempt from tax imposed under section 116 or 117 of the Act if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the purchaser is a First Nation individual or a band, and
the following are provided wholly on First Nation land:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the case of section 116 of the Act, the processing, fabrication, manufacturing, attachment or incorporation referred to in section 116 (2) (b) of the Act;
in the case of section 117 of the Act, the modification or processing of the tangible personal property referred to in section 117 (2) (b) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) of this section is prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (2) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to taxable services] of the Act.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Related Services in Relation to Tangible Personal Property

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tangible personal property for which service is exempt — general

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A related service provided in relation to the following tangible personal property is exempt from tax imposed under Division 2 of Part 5 of the Act, other than section 120.1 of that Part:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: tangible personal property that a person, other than a small seller, stores, keeps or retains solely for the purpose of resale;
tangible personal property that a registrant stores, keeps or retains solely for the purpose of leasing the tangible personal property to other persons;

tangible personal property that would be exempt from tax imposed under the Act if the tangible personal property were obtained on the date on which the service is provided, other than tangible personal property that would be exempt from tax under any of the provisions listed in section 57 (2) and (3) [parts] of this regulation;
tangible personal property that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: was brought or sent into British Columbia solely for the purpose of having the particular related service and any other related service provided in respect of the tangible personal property, and
was, immediately after the particular related service and any other related service was provided, transported outside British Columbia for use outside British Columbia;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an animal;
a manufactured building;
affixed machinery, other than

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: travelling cranes and hoists that

bcl:clause.bcl:text: run on rails or tracks attached to a building, and
are attached to the rails or tracks by flanged wheels, or rest on the rails or tracks by their own weight, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: affixed machinery, or parts of affixed machinery, that have been removed from the site at which they were affixed or installed;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following tangible personal property, if the tangible personal property is designed for household use:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: clothes dryers;
clothes washers;
curtains and draperies;
dishwashers;
freezers;
ovens;
refrigerators;
rugs and carpets;
rug-cleaning and carpet-cleaning machines;
sewing machines;
stoves;
vacuums;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: clothing and footwear, other than blades for skates;
a multijurisdictional vehicle;
tangible personal property that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is typically attached or applied to an individual, and
is and remains attached or applied to the individual after the service is provided.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 216/2013, App. 1, s. 12.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following are prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (2) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to taxable services] of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subsection (1) (a), (a.1), (c) and (i) of this section;
subsection (1) (b) of this section as it relates to tangible personal property that is a trailer obtained for use solely with multijurisdictional vehicles.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 145 (2) of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that a related service is exempt under subsection (1) (a) or (a.1) of this section, the collector is required to obtain

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that person's registration number, or
if that person does not have a registration number, a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 145 (2) of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that a related service provided in relation to a trailer obtained for use solely with multijurisdictional vehicles is exempt under subsection (1) (b) of this section, the collector is required to obtain the account number assigned to the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia, if the person licenses the vehicle in British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies, or

by the licensing authority in the jurisdiction in which the person licenses the vehicle, if the person licenses the vehicle outside British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 145 (2) of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that a related service is exempt under subsection (1) (i) of this section, the collector is required to obtain the account number assigned to the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia, if the person licenses the vehicle in British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies, or

by the licensing authority in the jurisdiction in which the person licenses the vehicle, if the person licenses the vehicle outside British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tangible personal property for which service is exempt — farmers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A related service provided in relation to tangible personal property described in Schedule 2 [Tangible Personal Property for Farm Purpose] is exempt from tax imposed under Division 2 of Part 5 of the Act, other than section 120.1 of that Part, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the related service is purchased by a qualifying farmer, and
the tangible personal property is to be used solely for a farm purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) of this section is prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (2) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to taxable services] of the Act.
For the purposes of section 145 (2) of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that a related service is exempt under subsection (1) of this section, the collector is required to obtain

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name, address, card number and expiry date as recorded on a BC Farmer Identity Card issued to that person by the BC Agriculture Council, or
a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tangible personal property for which service is exempt — commercial fishers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A related service provided in relation to a boat, a fishing net or fishing equipment is exempt from tax imposed under Division 2 of Part 5 of the Act, other than section 120.1 of that Part, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the related service is purchased by a qualifying commercial fisher, and
the boat, fishing net or fishing equipment is to be used solely for a commercial fishing purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) of this section is prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (2) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to taxable services] of the Act.

For the purposes of section 145 (2) (a) of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that a related service is exempt under subsection (1) of this section, the collector is required to obtain a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tangible personal property for which service is exempt — aquaculturists

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A related service provided in relation to tangible personal property described in Schedule 4 [Tangible Personal Property for Aquaculture Purpose] is exempt from tax imposed under Division 2 of Part 5 of the Act, other than section 120.1 of that Part, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the related service is purchased by a qualifying aquaculturist, and
the tangible personal property is to be used solely for an aquaculture purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) of this section is prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (2) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to taxable services] of the Act.

For the purposes of section 145 (2) (a) of the Act, in relation to a person who alleges that a related service is exempt under subsection (1) of this section, the collector is required to obtain a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Services provided outside British Columbia in relation to taxable conveyance
bcl:section.bcl:text: A related service provided in relation to a taxable conveyance, as defined in section 59 of the Act, is exempt from tax imposed under section 120 [tax if related service provided outside British Columbia] of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exempt services

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 77.2, the following related services are exempt from tax imposed under Division 2 of Part 5 of the Act, other than section 120.1 of that Part:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: towing of a motor vehicle;
boosting of a motor vehicle battery, other than battery recharging;
roadside tire changing of a motor vehicle;
roadside unlocking of a motor vehicle;
waxing of a motor vehicle;
a service provided solely for the purpose of modifying a motor vehicle to facilitate the use of the motor vehicle by, or the transportation of, an individual using a wheelchair;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a service provided solely for the purpose of equipping a motor vehicle with an auxiliary driving control to facilitate the operation of the motor vehicle by an individual with a disability;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following related services provided in relation to tangible personal property, if no other related service, other than a related service that is exempt from tax imposed under the Act, is provided in relation to the tangible personal property:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: diagnostic services, testing or safety inspections

bcl:clause.bcl:text: provided to the tangible personal property, or
to provide an estimate for related services to the tangible personal property;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: dismantling and any reassembly of the tangible personal property, if the dismantling and any reassembly are provided solely for the purpose of providing

bcl:clause.bcl:text: diagnostic services, testing or safety inspections to the tangible personal property, or
an estimate for related services to the tangible personal property;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: services to inspect, repair or replace tangible personal property as a result of a recall of the tangible personal property by its manufacturer, if the services are purchased by the manufacturer;
services to inspect, repair or replace tangible personal property under a warranty for which

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the purchaser of the tangible personal property paid or agreed to pay a charge described in section 10 (2) (i) of the Act, or
the lessee of the tangible personal property made a payment or provided consideration described in section 13 (2) (g) of the Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the services are purchased by the person who provided the warranty;
services to inspect, repair or replace tangible personal property for which

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the purchaser of the tangible personal property paid or agreed to pay a charge described in section 10 (2) (i) of the Act relating to the maintenance of or service to the tangible personal property, or

the lessee of the tangible personal property made a payment or provided consideration described in section 13 (2) (g) of the Act relating to the maintenance of or service to the tangible personal property;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: liquefying natural gas.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 77.2, the following related services are exempt from tax imposed under Division 2 of Part 5 of the Act, other than section 120.1 of that Part:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: attaching or applying tangible personal property to or removing tangible personal property from an individual;
services that are provided to an electronic device and that consist of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: installing software on the electronic device,
removing software or data from the electronic device,
relocating, modifying or copying software or data on the electronic device, or
installing data on the electronic device, if the purpose of the installation is to back up data installed on another electronic device;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: installing tangible personal property as part of a window display service;

erecting, constructing or assembling the following tangible personal property, if the tangible personal property is for use in the construction, demolition, adjustment, repair, renovation, restoration or maintenance of real property or affixed machinery:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: scaffolding, formwork, hoarding or other temporary protective coverings;
construction cranes;
temporary power or other utilities;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: dismantling tangible personal property described in paragraph (d) (i), (ii) or (iii), if the tangible personal property was used in the construction, demolition, adjustment, repair, renovation, restoration or maintenance of real property or affixed machinery;

cleaning services provided in relation to tangible personal property, if no other related service, other than a related service that is exempt from tax imposed under the Act, is provided in relation to the tangible personal property;
moving services;
courier and mail services;
freight transportation services;
disposal services;

services that measure, weigh, grade or classify tangible personal property, if no other related service, other than a related service that is exempt from tax imposed under the Act, is provided in relation to the tangible personal property;
engraving services;
packaging tangible personal property;
numbering pages, collating pages and folding pages;

cutting tangible personal property, other than cutting that is part or all of a service to repair, restore or recondition the tangible personal property, and only if no other related service, other than a related service that is exempt from tax imposed under the Act, is provided in relation to the tangible personal property;
services purchased by a corporation from a related corporation within the meaning of section 148 [definitions and interpretation for Part 9] of this regulation;
services that are

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: purchased by a First Nation individual or a band, and
provided wholly on First Nation land;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: services provided to grow plants if the service is provided at a location other than on property owned, leased or used by the owner of the plants.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (2) (q) of this section is prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (2) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to taxable services] of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Related services on commercial vessels

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A related service is exempt from tax imposed under Part 5 of the Act if the related service is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: purchased and provided on a passenger-carrying commercial vessel during the course of a scheduled sailing

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: from a port in British Columbia to a port outside British Columbia,
from a port outside British Columbia to a port in British Columbia, or
between ports outside British Columbia, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: purchased from a person who has an established commercial presence in one or more areas on board the vessel.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person referred to in subsection (1) (b) is exempt from the requirement to levy and collect tax in the circumstances described in subsection (1) (a) and (b).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Related services not exempt during lease of tangible personal property
bcl:section.bcl:text: In respect of tangible personal property leased by a lessor, the exemptions set out in section 77 (1) and (2) (a) to (n) do not apply to a related service provided by the lessor, or provided by a third party through a contract with the lessor, during the lease of the tangible personal property.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemptions in relation to accommodation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following accommodation is exempt from tax imposed under Division 3 of Part 5 of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: accommodation that is not listed on an online marketplace and for which the charge for the unit of accommodation is $30 or less per day, or $210 or less per week;
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 141/2018, Sch. 2, s. 1 (b).]
accommodation that is provided in a unit of accommodation to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an individual, other than a tourism agent, if the unit is occupied for a continuous period of 27 days or more by

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the individual,
the individual's employees,
members of the individual's family, or
members of the individual's employees' families,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a person, other than an individual or a tourism agent, if the unit is occupied for a continuous period of 27 days or more by

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the person's employees, or
members of the person's employees' families, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a tourism agent, if the unit is occupied for a continuous period of 27 days or more by the same customer of the tourism agent;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: accommodation that is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: purchased by a First Nation individual or a band, and
provided wholly on First Nation land;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: accommodation that is provided in premises normally operated by or on behalf of an employer to provide lodging to the employer's employees, if the accommodation is purchased by an employee of the employer;
accommodation that is provided

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: to an employee of an employer or another person engaged by the employer, and
in a bunk house, trailer or other dwelling that is operated at an industrial camp

bcl:clause.bcl:text: by or on behalf of the employer or under a contract with the employer, and
solely for the purpose of providing lodging substantially to the employees of the employer or other persons engaged by the employer

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: during periods when those employees or persons are performing work or services for the employer;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: accommodation that is provided

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by a religious or charitable organization, and
at a summer camp or similar place;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: accommodation that is provided without any of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: bed linen;
heat, other than a wood-burning fireplace or wood-burning stove;
electricity;
indoor plumbing;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: accommodation that is provided in tents;
accommodation that is provided by a person who does not list the accommodation on an online marketplace and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: whose gross revenue in the previous 12 months from the provision of accommodation, including accommodation referred to in paragraphs (a) to (i), is $2 500 or less, and

whose reasonable estimate of gross revenue in the 12 months after the 12 months referred to in subparagraph (i) from the provision of accommodation, including accommodation referred to in paragraphs (a) to (i), is $2 500 or less.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) (d) of this section is prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (2) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to taxable services] of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Division:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: law firm has the same meaning as in the Legal Profession Act;
notary firm means a legal entity or combination of legal entities providing services described in section 18 of the Notaries Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Legal services provided under contract
bcl:section.bcl:text: Legal services are exempt from tax imposed under Division 4 of Part 5 of the Act if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the legal services are provided to a lawyer, law firm, notary or notary firm by

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an individual who provides legal services only to the lawyer, law firm, notary or notary firm, but who is not an employee of the lawyer, law firm, notary or notary firm for the purposes of the Income Tax Act (Canada), or
a law firm or notary firm that provides legal services only to the lawyer, law firm, notary or notary firm,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the legal services are provided only in respect of a particular client of the lawyer, law firm, notary or notary firm, and

the purchase price to the lawyer, law firm, notary or notary firm for the legal services is to be included in the purchase price of legal services billed or otherwise charged to the client by the lawyer, law firm, notary or notary firm.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Legal services provided to First Nation individuals

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following are exempt from tax imposed under Division 4 of Part 5 of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: legal services purchased by a First Nation individual or a band, if the legal services

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: relate to real property situated on First Nation land, or
are performed on First Nation land;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: legal services purchased by an aboriginal organization representing the interests of Indians and bands, if the legal services relate to any of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: aboriginal treaty or land claims negotiations;
consultations with the government or the government of Canada in relation to aboriginal rights or aboriginal title;
negotiations with the government or the government of Canada in relation to interim agreements that relate to aboriginal rights or aboriginal title;
negotiations that relate to existing treaties or treaty rights;
negotiations with other aboriginal organizations in relation to overlapping treaty or land claims.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) of this section is prescribed for the purposes of section 145 (2) [evidence required to claim certain exemptions in relation to taxable services] of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Legal services provided to corporations
bcl:section.bcl:text: A corporation is exempt from tax imposed under Division 4 of Part 5 of the Act in relation to legal services provided to that corporation by an employee of a related corporation within the meaning of section 148 [definitions and interpretation for Part 9] of this regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Telephone and communication services

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, public switched telephone network means a telecommunication facility, the primary purpose of which is to provide, for compensation, a landline-based telephone service to the public.
The following are exempt from tax imposed under Division 5 of Part 5 of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a telecommunication service in the form of a toll-free number, other than if the telecommunication service is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: acquired for family or domestic use, or
a teleconference service.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a telecommunication service that is purchased by

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the government,
an agent of the government,
a regional district,
a municipality,
a fire department,
a police department,
the South Coast British Columbia Transportation Authority,
the Victoria Airport Authority,
the British Columbia Ambulance Service,
British Columbia Emergency Health Services,
British Columbia Transit, or
the University of Victoria

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of its emergency communications systems from

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: E-Comm Emergency Communications for British Columbia Incorporated, or
the Capital Region Emergency Service Telecommunications Incorporated (CREST);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: conventional paging services that allow a person to receive, but not to send, telecommunications by means of a pager;
subject to subsection (3), residential telephone services provided to a purchaser by means of a wire or cable and through a public switched telephone network.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The exemption under subsection (2) (d) does not apply to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: long distance telephone services;
telephone services provided to a purchaser by means of the internet.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Cable television services

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, basic cable television services means the minimum level of television services that a purchaser must purchase from a provider of television services to receive any television services from that provider.
Subject to subsection (3), basic cable television services provided to a purchaser by means of a wire or cable are exempt from tax imposed under Division 5 of Part 5 of the Act.
The exemption under subsection (2) does not apply to television services provided to a purchaser by means of satellite or the internet.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Education programs
bcl:section.bcl:text: A telecommunication service that is provided to a purchaser as part of the purchaser's participation in any of the following programs or activities and is provided only to participants of the program or activity by the person offering that program or activity is exempt from tax imposed under Division 5 of Part 5 of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an educational program provided by a qualifying school or other educational institution;
a training or instructional program designed to develop or improve the knowledge, skills or abilities needed by individuals for a particular trade, occupation or profession;

a lecture, presentation, seminar, workshop or similar activity designed for educational purposes, if the participants in the activity and the presenter or instructor utilize a telecommunication system to send and receive telecommunications with each other in real time.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Photographers
bcl:section.bcl:text: A purchaser is exempt from tax imposed under Division 5 of Part 5 of the Act in respect of a telecommunication service if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the purchaser purchases the telecommunication service from a person who produced a video specifically for the purchaser under a contract with that purchaser,

the telecommunication service is a telecommunication service described in paragraph (d) of the definition of "telecommunication service" in section 1 [definitions] of the Act in respect of the video referred to in paragraph (a) of this section, and
the purchaser does not obtain the video, or copies of the video, referred to in paragraph (a) in the form of tangible personal property.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Data back-up services
bcl:section.bcl:text: A telecommunication service that is provided to a purchaser for the purpose of backing up the purchaser's data that is installed on an electronic device is exempt from tax imposed under Division 5 of Part 5 of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Telecommunication service in relation to purchase of accommodation
bcl:section.bcl:text: A purchaser is exempt from tax imposed under Division 5 of Part 5 of the Act in respect of a telecommunication service if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the purchaser purchases the telecommunication service from a provider of accommodation, and
the telecommunication service is in relation to a purchase of accommodation in British Columbia.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Telecommunication service purchased by First Nation individual or band

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A telecommunication service is exempt from tax imposed under Division 5 of Part 5 of the Act if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the telecommunication service is purchased by a First Nation individual or a band, and
the electronic device is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: owned or leased by the First Nation individual or band, and
ordinarily situated on First Nation land.
