bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: documentation establishing that the eligible charity provided charity funds directly to the health authority, the health facility or the PHSA, as applicable, for the purpose of purchasing the medical equipment or software, and
a statement signed by an officer of the eligible charity authorizing the director to discuss the application with the health authority, the health facility or the PHSA, as applicable;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the medical equipment was purchased by a health authority or the PHSA, a statement signed by an administrator of the health authority or the PHSA, as applicable, certifying

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that the medical equipment is for use in the health facility referred to in paragraph (a) to treat patients or diagnose their ailments, and
that, if the health facility is a community care facility, the facility is licensed under section 11 of the Community Care and Assisted Living Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the medical equipment was purchased by the eligible charity or a health facility, a statement signed by an administrator of the health facility referred to in paragraph (a) certifying

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that the medical equipment is for use in the health facility to treat patients or diagnose their ailments, and
that, if the health facility is a community care facility, the facility is licensed under section 11 of the Community Care and Assisted Living Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An eligible charity may submit an application under section 165 of the Act in respect of a refund under subsection (2) or (3) of this section only if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the eligible charity has not submitted another application in the calendar year, or
the application is submitted on, or during the 6-month period before, the limitation date for that application.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (6) (a), a single application that relates to more than one refund under subsection (2) or (3) is to be considered one application.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tangible personal property and software purchased with parents' advisory council funds

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: authority means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a board of education, as defined in the School Act, or
a francophone education authority, as defined in that Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: limitation date, in respect of an application for a refund under subsection (2) or (3) of this section, is the date that is 4 years after the date on which the tax to which the application relates was paid;
PAC means a parents' advisory council;
PAC-raised funds, in relation to a PAC, means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: funds raised directly by the PAC through its fundraising activities,
cash donations made directly to the PAC, and
government funding provided directly to the PAC,

bcl:definition.bcl:text: but does not include funds provided to the PAC directly or indirectly by an authority;
relevant school means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a school, as defined in the School Act,
a francophone school, or
a Provincial school

bcl:definition.bcl:text: for which a PAC is established;
school year has the same meaning as in the School Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to this section, if the director is satisfied that a PAC or a relevant school paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in respect of tangible personal property, or under Part 4 of the Act in respect of Part 4 software, that was purchased

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in whole or in part with PAC-raised funds of the PAC, and
for use, at the relevant school for which the PAC is established, for school or student use,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the PAC the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount of tax paid under Part 3 of the Act in respect of the tangible personal property or under Part 4 of the Act in respect of the Part 4 software, and
the amount calculated under subsection (4) of this section in respect of the tangible personal property or Part 4 software.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to this section, if the director is satisfied that an authority paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in respect of tangible personal property, or under Part 4 of the Act in respect of Part 4 software, that was purchased

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in whole or in part with PAC-raised funds of a PAC, and
for use, at the relevant school for which the PAC is established, for school or student use,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the authority the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount of tax paid under Part 3 of the Act in respect of the tangible personal property or under Part 4 of the Act in respect of the Part 4 software, and
the amount calculated under subsection (4) of this section in respect of the tangible personal property or Part 4 software.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The amount referred to in subsection (2) (d) or (3) (d) in respect of tangible personal property or Part 4 software is equal to the amount determined by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the total amount of PAC-raised funds of the PAC used to purchase the tangible personal property or Part 4 software;
the purchase price of the tangible personal property or Part 4 software;
the amount of tax paid under Part 3 of the Act in respect of the tangible personal property or under Part 4 of the Act in respect of the Part 4 software.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application by a PAC under section 165 [claim for refund] of the Act for a refund under subsection (2) of this section must include all of the following for each item of tangible personal property or Part 4 software purchased with PAC-raised funds of the PAC:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name and address of the relevant school at which the tangible personal property or Part 4 software is to be used;
the amount of PAC-raised funds provided by the PAC that were used to purchase the tangible personal property or Part 4 software;
a statement signed by an administrator of the relevant school certifying that the tangible personal property or Part 4 software is for use at the relevant school for school or student use;
a statement signed by an officer of the PAC

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: certifying that PAC-raised funds of the PAC were used to purchase the tangible personal property or Part 4 software, and
authorizing the director to discuss the application with the relevant school.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application by an authority under section 165 of the Act for a refund under subsection (3) of this section must include all of the following for each item of tangible personal property or Part 4 software purchased with PAC-raised funds of the PAC referred to in that subsection:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name and address of the relevant school at which the tangible personal property or Part 4 software is to be used;
the amount of PAC-raised funds provided by the PAC that were used to purchase the tangible personal property or Part 4 software;
documentation establishing that the PAC provided PAC-raised funds directly to the authority for the purpose of purchasing the tangible personal property or Part 4 software;
a statement signed by an administrator of the authority

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: certifying that the tangible personal property or Part 4 software is for use at the relevant school for school or student use,
certifying that PAC-raised funds of the PAC were used to purchase the tangible personal property or Part 4 software, and
authorizing the director to discuss the application with the PAC and the relevant school.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person may submit an application under section 165 of the Act in respect of a refund under subsection (2) or (3) of this section only

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if, in respect of an application by a PAC, the PAC has not submitted another application in the school year,
if, in respect of an application by an authority, the authority has submitted fewer than 2 applications in the school year, or
if the application is submitted on, or during the 6-month period before, the limitation date for that application.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (7) (a) and (b), a single application that relates to more than one refund under subsection (2) or (3) is to be considered one application.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Motor vehicle transported outside British Columbia

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that a person who resides, ordinarily resides or carries on business in British Columbia purchased a motor vehicle at a sale in British Columbia and paid tax under Part 3 of the Act on the purchase,
that, within 30 days after the date on which the motor vehicle was purchased or the date on which the person took possession of the motor vehicle, whichever is later,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the motor vehicle was transported outside British Columbia to another jurisdiction for use solely outside British Columbia, and
the person established residence in the other jurisdiction, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that the person

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: paid sales tax under a law of the other jurisdiction in respect of the motor vehicle and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under that law, a refund of or a credit or rebate for that sales tax, or

paid tax under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act in respect of the motor vehicle and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under Part IX of that Act, a refund of or a credit or rebate for that tax,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection.
If the director is satisfied

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that a person who does not reside, ordinarily reside or carry on business in British Columbia purchased a motor vehicle at a sale in British Columbia and paid tax under Part 3 of the Act on the purchase, and

that, within 30 days after the date on which the motor vehicle was purchased or the date on which the person took possession of the motor vehicle, whichever is later, the motor vehicle was transported outside British Columbia for use primarily outside British Columbia,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.
If the director is satisfied

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that a person who does not reside, ordinarily reside or carry on business in British Columbia purchased a motor vehicle at a sale in British Columbia and paid tax under Part 3 of the Act on the purchase,

that, within 180 days after the date on which the motor vehicle was purchased or the date on which the person took possession of the motor vehicle, whichever is later, the motor vehicle was transported outside British Columbia to another jurisdiction for use primarily outside British Columbia, and
that the person

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: paid sales tax under a law of the other jurisdiction in respect of the motor vehicle and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under that law, a refund of or a credit or rebate for that sales tax, or

paid tax under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act in respect of the motor vehicle and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under Part IX of that Act, a refund of or a credit or rebate for that tax,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Used motor vehicles

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, in respect of a purchase or acquisition of a motor vehicle to which section 10.01 of the Act applies, a person provides the appraised value to the director, in a form and containing information acceptable to the director, within 30 days after the date of the application for registration of the motor vehicle under the vehicle registration legislation and the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person has paid to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia an amount of tax under section 37, 49, 50, or 52 of the Act, and
the designated purchase price and the appraised value are each less than the average wholesale value,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person that paid the amount of tax referred to in paragraph (a) the amount referred to in subsection (2).
The amount of the refund under subsection (1) is equal to the difference between

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount of tax paid by the person to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia under section 37, 49, 50 or 52, and
the amount of tax payable on the greater of the designated purchase price and the appraised value.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Resold motor vehicle

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that a person purchased a motor vehicle at a sale in British Columbia and paid tax under Part 3 of the Act on the purchase, and

that, within 7 days after the date on which the motor vehicle was purchased or the date on which the person took possession of the motor vehicle, whichever is later, the motor vehicle was sold to another person,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection the amount of tax paid referred to in that paragraph.

If the director is satisfied that a person paid tax under Division 2 of Part 5 of the Act in respect of a related service provided in relation to a motor vehicle referred to in subsection (1) of this section after the first sale referred to in that provision but before the resale referred to in that provision, the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.
Despite subsection (1) or (2), a refund must not be made on a claim for a refund under this section that is received by the director after October 1, 2021.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Promotional material

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a promotional distributor has provided promotional material to another person by way of promotional sale, and
the promotional distributor has paid tax under the Act in respect of the promotional material, other than in accordance with section 30.1 (1) or (2) of the Act,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the promotional distributor the amount referred to in subsection (2) of this section.
The amount of the refund under subsection (1) is equal to the difference between

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount of tax paid by the promotional distributor, and
the amount of tax that would have been payable had the purchase price of the promotional material been calculated at the time of the promotional sale.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Aircraft converted to electric operation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), if the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person obtained, other than by lease, an aircraft,
the person paid tax under one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: section 37, 49, 55 or 100 of the Act in respect of the aircraft;
section 37, 49 or 55 of the Act in respect of tangible personal property that was later used to convert the aircraft to be powered solely by electricity and became part of that aircraft;
section 119 of the Act in respect of related services provided to the aircraft to convert that aircraft to be powered solely by electricity, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person later converted the aircraft to be powered solely by electricity,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the total amount of tax referred to in subparagraphs (i) to (iii).

If a person obtained, other than by lease, an aircraft for a purpose other than to convert it to be powered solely by electricity, subsection (1) does not apply to tax referred to in subsection (1) (b) (i).
Subsection (1) does not apply to tax paid before February 19, 2020.
This section does not apply in respect of remotely piloted aircraft.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Vehicle, boat or aircraft returned to seller
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that a purchaser purchased a vehicle, boat or aircraft from a person other than a collector (the seller) at a sale in British Columbia and paid tax under Part 3 of the Act on the purchase, and
that, within 30 days after the date on which the vehicle, boat or aircraft was purchased or the date on which the purchaser took possession of the vehicle, boat or aircraft, whichever is later,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the purchaser returned the vehicle, boat or aircraft to the seller, and
in return for the vehicle, boat or aircraft, the seller refunded to the purchaser all or a portion of the purchase price,
the director must refund to the purchaser the amount of tax paid by the purchaser that is attributable to the amount of the refund of the purchase price.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Gift of vehicle, boat or aircraft between family members

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, related individual includes a sibling.
If the director is satisfied

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that an individual received a vehicle, boat or aircraft as a gift from a related individual,
that the individual paid tax imposed under section 100 [tax on gift of vehicle, boat or aircraft given in British Columbia] of the Act in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft,
that, after the date the individual received the vehicle, boat or aircraft, the related individual

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: was assessed an amount for tax payable under the Act, the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act or the Social Service Tax Act in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft, and
paid the amount referred to in subparagraph (i), any related penalty and any interest on that amount and the penalty, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that the related individual did not receive the vehicle, boat or aircraft as a gift during the 12 months before the date on which the related individual gave that vehicle, boat or aircraft to the individual,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the individual the amount of tax paid under section 100 of the Act in respect of that gift of the vehicle, boat or aircraft.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Gift of vehicle, boat or aircraft to registered charity
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that a registered charity received a vehicle, boat or aircraft as a gift,
that the registered charity paid tax imposed under section 100 [tax on gift of vehicle, boat or aircraft given in British Columbia] of the Act in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft, and
that, after the date the registered charity received the vehicle, boat or aircraft, the donor of the vehicle, boat or aircraft

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: was assessed an amount for tax payable under the Act, the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act or the Social Service Tax Act in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft, and
paid the amount referred to in subparagraph (i), any related penalty and any interest on that amount and the penalty,

bcl:section.bcl:text: the director must refund to the registered charity the amount of tax paid under section 100 of the Act in respect of that gift of the vehicle, boat or aircraft.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund for prizes, draws and awards

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, donor, in respect of a vehicle, boat or aircraft, means the person from whom the person referred to in subsection (2) (a) received the vehicle, boat or aircraft.
If the director is satisfied

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that a person received a vehicle, boat or aircraft as a result of any of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a lawful lottery scheme within the meaning of section 207 of the Criminal Code;
a contest, a game of chance or skill or mixed chance and skill, or a disposition by any mode of chance, skill or mixed chance and skill;
an achievement in a field of endeavour, including athletic or sporting events;
a draw or awarding of a prize if the only consideration provided by the person was in the form of an entrance or admission fee, a ticket fee or another similar charge,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that the person did not receive the vehicle, boat or aircraft as a result of a private arrangement, including a wager, between 2 or more persons,
that the person paid tax imposed under section 100 [tax on gift of vehicle, boat or aircraft given in British Columbia] of the Act in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft, and
that, after the date the person received the vehicle, boat or aircraft, the donor

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: was assessed an amount for tax payable under the Act, the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act or the Social Service Tax Act in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft, and
paid the amount referred to in subparagraph (i), any related penalty and any interest on that amount and the penalty,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid under section 100 of the Act in respect of that gift of the vehicle, boat or aircraft.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Gifts of tangible personal property from outside Canada

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, tangible personal property does not include a vehicle, boat or aircraft.
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person paid tax under section 49, 50 or 55 [property brought into British Columbia from outside Canada] of the Act in respect of tangible personal property that the person received as a gift from a donor,
the donor of the tangible personal property

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: paid tax under the Act or the Social Service Tax Act in respect of the tangible personal property and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under those Acts, a refund of that tax,

paid tax under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act in respect of the tangible personal property and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under Part IX of that Act, a refund of or a credit or rebate for that tax,

paid sales tax under a law of another jurisdiction in respect of the tangible personal property and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under that law, a refund of or a credit or rebate for that sales tax,
received, before April 1, 2013, the tangible personal property as a gift in British Columbia, or
was exempt, when the tangible personal property was obtained, from tax

bcl:clause.bcl:text: under the Social Service Tax Act, or

under the Act, other than under section 24 [vehicle purchased for use outside British Columbia], 25 [aircraft purchased for use outside British Columbia] or 26 [tangible personal property shipped outside British Columbia] of this regulation,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax paid referred to in that paragraph.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Gifts, prizes, draws and awards from outside Canada

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), if the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an individual paid tax under section 49, 50 or 55 [property brought into British Columbia from outside Canada] of the Act in respect of a vehicle, boat or aircraft,
the individual received the vehicle, boat or aircraft as a gift from a related individual, as defined in section 18 (1) [gifts between family members] of this regulation, and
the related individual

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: paid tax under the Act, the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act or the Social Service Tax Act in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under those Acts, a refund of that tax,

paid tax under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under Part IX of that Act, a refund of or a credit or rebate for that tax,

paid sales tax under a law of another jurisdiction in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under that law, a refund of or a credit or rebate for that sales tax,
received, before April 1, 2013, the vehicle, boat or aircraft as a gift in British Columbia, or
was exempt, when the vehicle, boat or aircraft was obtained, from tax

bcl:clause.bcl:text: under the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act or the Social Service Tax Act, or

under the Act, other than under section 24 [vehicle purchased for use outside British Columbia], 25 [aircraft purchased for use outside British Columbia] or 26 [tangible personal property shipped outside British Columbia] of this regulation,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the individual referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax paid referred to in that paragraph.
A person is not entitled to a refund under subsection (1) of tax paid in respect of a vehicle, boat or aircraft if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the related individual referred to in subsection (1) (b) of this section paid tax in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft only under one or both of section 51 [tangible personal property brought into British Columbia for temporary use] of the Act and section 12 [calculation of tax if use in British Columbia temporary] of the Social Service Tax Act, and
the total amount of tax referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection is less than the amount of tax paid referred to in subsection (1) (a) of this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (4) and (5) of this section, if the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an individual paid tax under section 49, 50 or 55 of the Act in respect of a vehicle, boat or aircraft,
the individual received the vehicle, boat or aircraft as a result of any of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a contest, a game of chance or skill or mixed chance and skill, or a disposition by any mode of chance, skill or mixed chance and skill;
an achievement in a field of endeavour, including athletic or sporting events;
a draw or awarding of a prize if the only consideration provided by the individual was in the form of an entrance or admission fee, a ticket fee or another similar charge, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person who provided the vehicle, boat or aircraft to the individual

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: paid tax under the Act, the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act or the Social Service Tax Act in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under those Acts, a refund of that tax,

paid tax under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under Part IX of that Act, a refund of or a credit or rebate for that tax,

paid sales tax under a law of another jurisdiction in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under that law, a refund of or a credit or rebate for that sales tax,
received, before April 1, 2013, the vehicle, boat or aircraft as a gift in British Columbia, or
was exempt, when the vehicle, boat or aircraft was obtained, from tax

bcl:clause.bcl:text: under the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act or the Social Service Tax Act, or

under the Act, other than under section 24 [vehicle purchased for use outside British Columbia], 25 [aircraft purchased for use outside British Columbia] or 26 [tangible personal property shipped outside British Columbia] of this regulation,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the individual referred to in paragraph (a) the amount of tax paid referred to in that paragraph.

An individual is not entitled to a refund under subsection (3) if the individual received the vehicle, boat or aircraft as a result of a private arrangement, including a wager, between 2 or more persons.
An individual is not entitled to a refund under subsection (3) of tax paid in respect of a vehicle, boat or aircraft if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person referred to in subsection (3) (c) of this section paid tax in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft only under one or both of section 51 [tangible personal property brought into British Columbia for temporary use] of the Act and section 12 [calculation of tax if use in British Columbia temporary] of the Social Service Tax Act, and
the total amount of tax referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection is less than the amount of tax paid referred to in subsection (3) (a) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund of tax paid by contractor

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a contractor purchased tangible personal property at a sale in British Columbia,
the contractor paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in relation to the tangible personal property,

the contractor used the tangible personal property to fulfill a written contract under which the contractor was required to supply and affix, or install, affixed machinery or improvements to real property,
under the terms of the contract, the tangible personal property was used so that it ceased to be personal property at common law,
the other party who entered into the contract with the contractor is one of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the government of Canada;
a person who would be exempt under the Act from tax imposed under section 37 of the Act if the person were to purchase the tangible personal property;
a First Nation individual or band, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a contract entered into with a First Nation individual or band, under the terms of the contract, title to and possession of the tangible personal property was transferred to the First Nation individual or band on First Nation land before the tangible personal property was used to fulfill the contract,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the contractor the tax paid under Part 3 of the Act in relation to the tangible personal property.
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a contractor brought or sent into British Columbia, or received delivery of in British Columbia, tangible personal property,
the contractor paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in relation to the tangible personal property,

the contractor used the tangible personal property to fulfill a written contract under which the contractor was required to supply and affix, or install, affixed machinery or improvements to real property,
under the terms of the contract, the tangible personal property was used so that it ceased to be personal property at common law,
the other party who entered into the contract with the contractor is one of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the government of Canada;

a person who would be exempt under the Act from tax imposed under section 49 of the Act if the person were to bring or send into British Columbia, or receive delivery of in British Columbia, the tangible personal property;
a First Nation individual or band, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a contract entered into with a First Nation individual or band, under the terms of the contract, title to and possession of the tangible personal property was transferred to the First Nation individual or band on First Nation land before the tangible personal property was used to fulfill the contract,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the contractor the tax paid under Part 3 of the Act in relation to the tangible personal property.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Residential energy products used for residential use
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that a person paid tax under Part 3 of the Act, other than Division 11 of that Part, in respect of a residential energy product used for residential use in a residential dwelling, the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid by the person that can reasonably be attributed to the portion of the residential energy product used for residential use in a residential dwelling.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Substances on which tax paid under Motor Fuel Tax Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, non-motor fuel oil has the same meaning as in the Motor Fuel Tax Act.
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in respect of heating oil or non-motor fuel oil and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under the Act, a refund of that tax, and

the person paid tax under section 16.7 (5) [tax on heating oil or non-motor fuel oil used for unauthorized purpose] of the Motor Fuel Tax Act in respect of the heating oil or non-motor fuel oil and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under that Act, a refund of that tax,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tangible personal property used for farm purpose

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, qualifying part has the same meaning as in section 46 (1) [farmers].
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person obtained tangible personal property described in Schedule 2 [Tangible Personal Property for Farm Purpose] and paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in respect of the tangible personal property,
the person, from the date on which the tangible personal property was obtained, used the tangible personal property solely for a farm purpose, and
the person, within 2 years after the date on which the tangible personal property was obtained, became a qualifying farmer,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person obtained a qualifying part and paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in respect of the qualifying part,
the person used the qualifying part

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: as a replacement part for tangible personal property described in Schedule 2, or
in the manufacture or repair of tangible personal property described in Schedule 2,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person, from the date on which the qualifying part was used for a purpose referred to in paragraph (b) of this subsection, used the tangible personal property solely for a farm purpose, and
the person, within 2 years after the date on which the qualifying part was obtained, became a qualifying farmer,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person paid tax under Division 2 of Part 5 of the Act in respect of a related service provided in relation to tangible personal property described in Schedule 2,
the person, from the date on which the service was provided, used the tangible personal property solely for a farm purpose, and
the person, within 2 years after the date on which the service was provided, became a qualifying farmer,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tangible personal property and software used for commercial fishing purpose

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, qualifying part has the same meaning as in section 48 (1) [commercial fishers].
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person obtained a boat, fishing net or fishing equipment and paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in respect of the boat, fishing net or fishing equipment,
the person, from the date on which the boat, fishing net or fishing equipment was obtained, used the boat, fishing net or fishing equipment solely for a commercial fishing purpose, and
the person, within one year after the date on which the boat, fishing net or fishing equipment was obtained, became a qualifying commercial fisher,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person obtained software designed for use on electronic monitoring equipment described in item 22 of Schedule 3 [Fishing Equipment for Commercial Fishing Purpose] and paid tax under Part 4 of the Act in respect of the software,
the person, from the date on which the software was obtained, used the electronic monitoring equipment solely for a commercial fishing purpose, and
the person, within one year after the date on which the software was obtained, became a qualifying commercial fisher,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person obtained a qualifying part and paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in respect of the qualifying part,
the person used the qualifying part for the repair or reconditioning of a boat, fishing net or fishing equipment,

the person, from the date on which the qualifying part was used for a purpose referred to in paragraph (b) of this subsection, used the boat, fishing net or fishing equipment solely for a commercial fishing purpose, and
the person, within one year after the date on which the qualifying part was obtained, became a qualifying commercial fisher,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person obtained materials for use in the repair or reconditioning of a boat and paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in respect of the materials,
the person used the materials for the repair or reconditioning of a boat,
the person, from the date on which the materials were used for a purpose referred to in paragraph (b) of this subsection, used the boat solely for a commercial fishing purpose, and
the person,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: on the date on which the materials were obtained, was a qualifying commercial fisher, or
within one year after the date on which the materials were obtained, became a qualifying commercial fisher,
the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person paid tax under Division 2 of Part 5 of the Act in respect of a related service provided in relation to a boat, fishing net or fishing equipment,
the person, from the date on which the service was provided, used the boat, fishing net or fishing equipment solely for a commercial fishing purpose, and
the person, within one year after the date on which the service was provided, became a qualifying commercial fisher,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tangible personal property used for aquaculture purpose

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, qualifying part has the same meaning as in section 49 (1) [aquaculturists].
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person obtained tangible personal property described in Schedule 4 [Tangible Personal Property for Aquaculture Purpose] and paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in respect of the tangible personal property,
the person, from the date on which the tangible personal property was obtained, used the tangible personal property solely for an aquaculture purpose, and
the person, within 6 months after the date on which the tangible personal property was obtained, became a qualifying aquaculturist,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person obtained a qualifying part and paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in respect of the qualifying part,
the person used the qualifying part

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: as a replacement part for tangible personal property described in Schedule 4, or
in the manufacture or repair of tangible personal property described in Schedule 4,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person, from the date on which the qualifying part was used for a purpose referred to in paragraph (b) of this subsection, used the tangible personal property solely for an aquaculture purpose, and
the person, within 6 months after the date on which the qualifying part was obtained, became a qualifying aquaculturist,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person paid tax under Division 2 of Part 5 of the Act in respect of a related service provided in relation to tangible personal property described in Schedule 4,
the person, from the date on which the service was provided, used the tangible personal property solely for an aquaculture purpose, and
the person, within 6 months after the date on which the service was provided, became a qualifying aquaculturist,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Claiming races

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), if the director is satisfied that, on or after April 1, 2013, a person repurchased a horse at a claiming race and paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in respect of the repurchase, the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.

As a limit on subsection (1), the amount of a refund under that subsection must not exceed the amount of tax paid by the person, on the most recent purchase of that horse by that person before the horse's repurchase,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: under the Act or the Social Service Tax Act and for which that person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under those Acts, or

under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act, in respect of British Columbia as a participating province under Part IX of that Act, and for which that person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund, credit or rebate under Part IX of that Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tangible personal property and software used after tax paid under tax payment agreement
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in relation to tangible personal property, or under Part 4 of the Act in relation to software, in accordance with an agreement entered into under section 32 of the Act,
the tax was payable on or before the date prescribed by section 14 (a) (ii) or (b) (ii) of the Provincial Sales Tax Regulation, and

when the person became a user of the tangible personal property or software, other than in respect of the storing, keeping or retaining of the tangible personal property or software, the tangible personal property or software was used for a purpose for which the tangible personal property or software would have been exempt from tax under Part 3 or 4 of the Act if that tangible personal property or software were to have been used for that purpose when the person

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: brought or sent into British Columbia, received delivery of in British Columbia, purchased or leased the tangible personal property, or
purchased the software,

bcl:section.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid in relation to the tangible personal property or software.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Delivery charge for aggregate

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, aggregate and delivery charge have the same meaning as in section 60.3 [delivery charge for aggregate].
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a purchaser purchased aggregate on or after April 1, 2018,
the purchaser paid tax under Part 3 of the Act in respect of the portion of the purchase price of the aggregate that is a delivery charge, and
the purchaser was not required to pay the delivery charge in order to purchase the aggregate,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the purchaser the amount of tax paid.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Purchase of accommodation for 27 days or more

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person paid tax under Division 3 of Part 5 of the Act in respect of a purchase of accommodation, and
the accommodation was provided in a unit of accommodation to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an individual, other than a tourism agent, and the unit was occupied for a continuous period of 27 days or more by

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the individual,
the individual's employees,
members of the individual's family, or
members of the individual's employees' families,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a person, other than an individual or a tourism agent, and the unit was occupied for a continuous period of 27 days or more by

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the person's employees, or
members of the person's employees' families, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a tourism agent, and the unit was occupied for a continuous period of 27 days or more by the same customer of the tourism agent,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of tax paid.

Despite subsection (1), in applying that subsection in relation to accommodation purchased before October 1, 2018, a reference to "27 days or more" is to be read as a reference to "more than one month".

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund or deduction for bad debts

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of the definition of "specified amount" in section 159 (1) [refund or deduction for bad debts] of the Act, the specified amount in relation to a transaction must be determined in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the amount written off as unrealizable or uncollectable in respect of the transaction, but not including interest charges;
the amount of tax referred to in section 159 (2) (b) of the Act remitted by the person in respect of the transaction;
the full amount of the consideration in respect of the transaction including all applicable taxes, but not including interest charges.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A registrant who makes a deduction under section 159 (3) of the Act must submit to the director any information or document required by the director.
For the purposes of section 159 (6) of the Act, the amount a registrant must add to the tax remitted by the registrant under the Act must be determined in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: amount to be added = tax remitted ×
the amount recovered by the registrant that gives rise to the obligation under section 159 (6) of the Act to add an amount to the tax remitted by the registrant under the Act;
the amount of tax referred to in section 159 (2) (b) of the Act remitted by the person in respect of the transaction;
the full amount of the consideration in respect of the transaction including all applicable taxes, but not including interest charges.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 159 (7) of the Act, the amount a person must pay to the government must be determined in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: amount to be paid = tax remitted ×
the amount recovered by the person that gives rise to the obligation under section 159 (7) of the Act to pay an amount to the government;
the amount of tax referred to in section 159 (2) (b) of the Act remitted by the person in respect of the transaction;
the full amount of the consideration in respect of the transaction including all applicable taxes, but not including interest charges.

bcl:part.bcl:text:
Refunds and Credits for
Multijurisdictional Vehicles

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Credit if vehicle ceases to be multijurisdictional

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: applicable period, in respect of a vehicle referred to in section 72 (5) or 72.1 (5) of the Act, means the last vehicle licence period during which the vehicle was licensed under a prorating agreement;
prorate period amount means the amount calculated under subsection (4) of this section for a vehicle;
purchase price has the same meaning as for the purposes of section 72 or 72.1 of the Act, as applicable;
remaining balance amount means the amount calculated under subsection (3) of this section for a vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The amount of the credit under section 72 (5) or 72.1 (5) of the Act for a vehicle,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the vehicle ceases to be licensed under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies before the end of the vehicle licence period, is the sum of the remaining balance amount and the prorate period amount for the vehicle, and
in any other case, is the prorate period amount for the vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (2) of this section, the remaining balance amount for a vehicle must be calculated as follows:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the tax paid under one or both of sections 69 [tax if multijurisdictional vehicle licensed] and 71 [adjustment of tax under section 69] of the Act in respect of the vehicle for the applicable period;
the number of whole months left in the applicable period at the time that the vehicle ceases to be licensed under the licence to which the prorating agreement applies;
the number of whole and partial months in the applicable period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (2) of this section, the prorate period amount for a vehicle must be calculated as follows:

oasis:entry.oasis:line:
purchase price × total months
× average travel ratio × 7%
the purchase price of the vehicle;
the number of whole months, up to a maximum of 60, in which the vehicle was licensed under the licence to which the prorating agreement applies, divided by 60;
the average travel ratio during the total period the vehicle was licensed under the licence to which the prorating agreement applies.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund or credit of tax if fleet licensing changed

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: applicable period, in respect of a vehicle referred to in section 74 (1) of the Act, means the last vehicle licence period under the previous licence referred to in section 74 (1) (b) or (1.2) (b) of the Act;
different fleet, in respect of a vehicle referred to in section 74 (1) of the Act, means the different fleet referred to in section 74 (1) or (1.1) (c) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The amount of the credit under section 74 (2) of the Act or the amount of the refund under section 74 (3) of the Act for a vehicle must be calculated in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: amount of credit or refund = tax paid ×
the tax paid under one or both of sections 69 [tax if multijurisdictional vehicle licensed] and 71 [adjustment of tax under section 69] of the Act in respect of the vehicle for the applicable period;
the number of whole months remaining in the applicable period at the time the vehicle is licensed as part of the different fleet;
the number of whole and partial months in the applicable period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund if vehicle ceases to be multijurisdictional

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, applicable period means the last vehicle licence period during which a vehicle referred to in section 74.1 (1) of the Act was licensed under a prorating agreement.
The amount of the refund under section 74.1 (1) of the Act for a vehicle must be calculated as follows:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the tax paid under one or both of sections 69 [tax if multijurisdictional vehicle licensed] and 71 [adjustment of tax under section 69] of the Act in respect of the vehicle for the applicable period;
the number of whole months left in the applicable period at the time that the vehicle ceases to be licensed under the licence to which the prorating agreement applies;
the number of whole and partial months in the applicable period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund at end of vehicle licence period

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The amount of the refund under section 74.2 (1) of the Act in respect of a vehicle for a vehicle licence period is the amount calculated in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the tax paid under one or both of sections 69 [tax if multijurisdictional vehicle licensed] and 71 [adjustment of tax under section 69] of the Act in respect of the vehicle for the vehicle licence period;
the number of whole months left in the vehicle licence period at the time that the vehicle ceased to be licensed under the licence to which the prorating agreement applies;
the number of whole and partial months in the vehicle licence period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Credit if tax previously paid

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The amount of the credit under section 75 (1) or (1.1) or 75.1 (1) or (2) of the Act for a vehicle must be calculated in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: amount of credit = taxable value × credit factor × travel ratio × travel months
the tax credit factor, for the calendar year in respect of which the credit is claimed,
established under subsection (2) of this section, if the vehicle is not a bus, or
established under subsection (3) of this section, if the vehicle is a bus;
the travel ratio for the vehicle;
the number of whole and partial months in the vehicle licence period at the time that the vehicle is licensed, divided by 12.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The tax credit factor referred to in subsection (1) of this section for a calendar year in respect of which a credit is claimed for a vehicle other than a bus is the tax credit factor shown opposite the applicable calendar year as follows:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: 1st calendar year after the acquisition year
2nd calendar year after the acquisition year
3rd calendar year after the acquisition year
4th calendar year after the acquisition year

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The tax credit factor referred to in subsection (1) of this section for a calendar year in respect of which a credit is claimed for a bus is the tax credit factor shown opposite the applicable calendar year as follows:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: 1st calendar year after the acquisition year
2nd calendar year after the acquisition year
3rd calendar year after the acquisition year
4th calendar year after the acquisition year

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refunds from Insurance Corporation of British Columbia

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person has paid to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia an amount as tax under section 69 of the Act that, as a result of a clerical error, is in excess of the amount of tax payable under that section, the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia may refund to the person the amount of the excess.

If the director is satisfied that a person has paid to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia an amount as tax under section 69 of the Act that is in excess of the amount of tax payable under that section, the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia, on receiving notice from the director, may refund to the person the amount of the excess.
The Insurance Corporation of British Columbia may refund to a person the amount of tax paid under section 69 of the Act by the person in respect of a vehicle licence period if the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: licensed a vehicle in British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies for the vehicle licence period,
paid tax under section 69 of the Act to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia in respect of the licence referred to in paragraph (a), and
cancels the licence referred to in paragraph (a) before the licence comes into effect.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Special refunds by Insurance Corporation of British Columbia

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia may refund to a person an amount of tax paid under section 69 of the Act in respect of a vehicle licence period if the vehicle ceases to be licensed, under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies, on a date that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: within the vehicle licence period, and
after March 10, 2020 but before October 1, 2020.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia does not exercise its discretion under subsection (1) to pay a refund to a person, the director may pay the refund if the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person paid to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia tax under section 69 of the Act in respect of a vehicle licence period, and
the requirement in respect of the vehicle, set out in subsection (1), is met.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person may not be paid a refund under subsection (1) if the director pays a refund under subsection (2).
The amount of the refund under subsection (1) or (2) is the amount calculated in accordance with the formula set out in section 137.1 as if the refund were payable under section 74.2 of the Act.
A person to whom a refund is paid under subsection (1) or (2) must repay to the government an amount equal to the refund if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia has provided a credit in respect of the same vehicle for the same vehicle licence period under section 74 (2) or 76 (2) of the Act, or
the director has paid a refund, in respect of the same vehicle for the same vehicle licence period, under section 74 (3), 74.1, 74.2 or 76 (3) of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund or credit for trade-in vehicles
bcl:section.bcl:text: The amount of the credit under section 76 (2) of the Act or the amount of the refund under section 76 (3) of the Act for a trade-in vehicle must be calculated in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the tax paid under Division 7 of Part 3 of the Act on the trade-in vehicle at the beginning of the vehicle licence period in which the vehicle is traded in against the purchase of the new vehicle;
the number of whole months remaining in the trade-in vehicle's vehicle licence period at the time the vehicle is traded in against the purchase of the new vehicle.

bcl:part.bcl:text: Refunds and Credits for Exclusive Products

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund or credit if subsequent sale to exempt purchaser
bcl:section.bcl:text: If a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is an independent sales contractor of a direct seller,
has obtained an exclusive product from the direct seller or another independent sales contractor of the direct seller,
has paid tax under section 99 [tax on acquisition of exclusive product by independent sales contractor] of the Act in relation to the exclusive product, and
has sold the exclusive product to a purchaser who was not liable to pay tax on that purchase,

bcl:section.bcl:text: the direct seller may, within 180 days of the date on which the person paid the tax under section 99 of the Act, refund or credit to the person the amount of tax paid.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund or credit if subsequent sale for less than suggested retail price
bcl:section.bcl:text: If

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is an independent sales contractor of a direct seller,
has obtained an exclusive product from the direct seller or another independent sales contractor of the direct seller,
has paid tax under section 99 [tax on acquisition of exclusive product by independent sales contractor] of the Act in relation to the exclusive product, and
has sold the exclusive product to a purchaser, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the purchase price paid by the purchaser is less than the direct seller's suggested retail price,

bcl:section.bcl:text: the direct seller may, within 180 days of the date on which the person paid the tax under section 99 of the Act, refund or credit to the person an amount equal to the amount, if any, by which the amount of tax paid by the person under section 99 of the Act exceeds the amount of tax levied by the person on the purchase price of the exclusive product under section 180 [collection of tax by independent sales contractor] of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund or credit if exclusive product used by independent sales contractor or provided to another person at no cost

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a person who

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is an independent sales contractor of a direct seller,
has obtained an exclusive product from the direct seller or another independent sales contractor of the direct seller,
has paid tax under section 99 [tax on acquisition of exclusive product by independent sales contractor] of the Act in relation to the exclusive product, and
uses or consumes the exclusive product or provides the exclusive product to another person at no cost for use or consumption by that other person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If this section applies to a person under subsection (1), the direct seller may, within 180 days of the date on which the person paid the tax under section 99 of the Act, refund or credit to the person an amount equal to the amount by which the amount of tax paid by the person under section 99 of the Act exceeds the amount of tax that would have been payable by the person in relation to the exclusive product under, as applicable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 37 [tax on purchase] of the Act if section 37 (2) (c.1) of the Act had not applied, or
Division 4 [Tangible Personal Property Brought into British Columbia] of Part 3 of the Act if section 48 (a) [application of Division 4] of that Division had not applied.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund or credit if exclusive product returned to direct seller

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is an independent sales contractor of a direct seller,
has obtained an exclusive product from the direct seller or another independent sales contractor of the direct seller,
has paid tax under section 99 [tax on acquisition of exclusive product by independent sales contractor] of the Act in relation to the exclusive product, and
returns the exclusive product to the direct seller, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the direct seller refunds or credits to the person all or a portion of the consideration paid by the person for the purchase of the exclusive product,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the direct seller may, at the time the refund or credit of the consideration is paid or allowed, refund or credit to the person the amount of tax paid by the person that is attributable to the amount of the refund or credit of the consideration.

A direct seller may pay or allow a refund or credit to a person under subsection (1) only if the refund or credit is paid or allowed within 180 days of the date on which the person paid the tax under section 99 of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund by director if direct seller does not provide refund or credit

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, relevant provision means any of sections 140 to 143.
If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: all of the requirements in a relevant provision for the payment of a refund or allowance of a credit to a person have been met, and
the direct seller

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: did not pay or allow the refund or credit, or
paid or allowed less than the full amount of the refund or credit,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person an amount equal to the amount of the refund or credit the direct seller did not pay or allow.

The director may require that a person request a direct seller to pay a refund or allow a credit under a relevant provision in relation to an exclusive product before the person may apply to the director for a refund under this section in respect of that exclusive product.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund by director for bad debts

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, transaction means a transaction referred to in subsection (2) (d) of this section.
This section applies to a person in respect of an exclusive product if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is an independent sales contractor of a direct seller,
the person has obtained the exclusive product from the direct seller or another independent sales contractor of the direct seller,
the person has paid tax under section 99 [tax on acquisition of exclusive product by independent sales contractor] of the Act in relation to the exclusive product,
the person sells the exclusive product to a purchaser,
the person, in accordance with the Act, has levied the tax required to be levied under section 180 (1) [collection of tax by independent sales contractor] of the Act for the transaction,
the purchaser does not pay to the person the full amount of the consideration in respect of the transaction, and
the person within 4 years of the date on which the tax referred to in paragraph (c) was paid, writes off as unrealizable or uncollectable the amount owing by the purchaser.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that this section applies to a person in respect of an exclusive product, the director must refund to the person the portion, determined in accordance with subsection (4) of this section, of the amount of the tax paid by the person under section 99 of the Act in relation to the exclusive product.

For the purposes of subsection (3) of this section, the portion of the amount of the tax paid by a person under section 99 of the Act in relation to an exclusive product must be determined in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: portion to be refunded = tax levied ×
the amount of tax levied by the person under section 180 (1) of the Act in relation to the exclusive product;
the amount written off as unrealizable or uncollectable in respect of the transaction, but not including interest charges;
the full amount of the consideration in respect of the transaction including all applicable taxes, but not including interest charges.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person who obtained a refund under subsection (3) of this section recovers some or all of the amount referred to in subsection (2) (g) of this section, the person must pay to the government an amount, determined in accordance with subsection (6) of this section, on or before the last day of the month following the month in which the recovery was made.
For the purposes of subsection (5) of this section, the amount a person must pay to the government must be determined in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: amount to be paid = tax levied ×
the amount of tax levied by the person under section 180 (1) of the Act in relation to the exclusive product;
the amount recovered by the person that gives rise to the obligation under subsection (5) of this section to pay an amount to the government;
the full amount of the consideration in respect of the transaction including all applicable taxes, but not including interest charges.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund by director if exclusive product not sold
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is an independent sales contractor of a direct seller,
has obtained an exclusive product from the direct seller or another independent sales contractor of the direct seller,
has paid tax under section 99 [tax on acquisition of exclusive product by independent sales contractor] of the Act in relation to the exclusive product,
has not used or consumed and will not use or consume the exclusive product,
has not provided and will not provide the exclusive product to another person at no cost for use or consumption by that other person, and
has not returned and will not return the exclusive product to the direct seller, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the exclusive product was not sold and will not be sold to a purchaser,

bcl:section.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the amount of the tax paid.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: No more than one refund or credit

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An independent sales contractor of a direct seller who has received or been allowed a refund or credit in respect of tax paid under section 99 [tax on acquisition of exclusive product by independent sales contractor] of the Act in relation to an exclusive product is not entitled to and must not request a refund from the director in respect of the same tax paid under section 99 of the Act in relation to the exclusive product.

An independent sales contractor of a direct seller who has received a refund from the director in respect of tax paid under section 99 of the Act in relation to an exclusive product is not entitled to and must not request a refund or credit from the direct seller in respect of the same tax paid under section 99 of the Act in relation to the exclusive product.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions and interpretation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this Part, related corporation means a corporation that is related to another corporation within the meaning of subsection (2).
For the purposes of this Part, a corporation is related to another corporation if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: one of them is a wholly owned subsidiary of the other, or
both of them are wholly owned subsidiaries of the same corporation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this subsection and subsection (2), a corporation is a wholly owned subsidiary of another corporation if at least 95% of the outstanding shares of each class of the share capital of the first corporation are beneficially owned by one or both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that other corporation;
a wholly owned subsidiary, or wholly owned subsidiaries, of that other corporation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (5), for the purposes of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 151 [tangible personal property transferred to new corporation — wholly owned and controlled],
section 152 [tangible personal property transferred to new corporation — not wholly owned and controlled],
section 154 [software transferred to new corporation — wholly owned and controlled], and
section 155 [software transferred to new corporation — not wholly owned and controlled],

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: a person wholly owns and controls a corporation if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person beneficially owns shares in the corporation, and
at least 95% of the outstanding shares of each class of the share capital of the corporation are beneficially owned by that person or by that person and that person's spouse.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of sections 151, 152, 154 and 155, a person referred to in subsection (4) of this section continues to wholly own and control a corporation despite transferring,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: without consideration, shares in the corporation to a trustee of a trust whose only beneficiaries are one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the person;
the person's spouse;
the person's children, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: with or without consideration, shares in the corporation to a trustee of a trust whose only beneficiaries are the person's spouse or the person and the person's spouse.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Tangible Personal Property Transferred between Related Parties

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tangible personal property transferred between related corporations

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: previous owner, in relation to tangible personal property, means the related corporation referred to in subsection (2) (a), (b) or (c), as applicable;
transfer date means the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of tangible personal property referred to in subsection (2) (a), the date on which the tangible personal property is purchased by the corporation referred to in that subsection;
in respect of tangible personal property referred to in subsection (2) (b), the date on which the tangible personal property was acquired by the corporation referred to in that subsection;
in respect of tangible personal property referred to in subsection (2) (c), the date on which the tangible personal property is received as a gift by the corporation referred to in that subsection.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (3), (12) and (14) to (16),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a corporation is exempt from tax imposed under any of the following provisions of the Act in respect of tangible personal property if the corporation purchases the tangible personal property from a related corporation:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: Division 2 [Purchases of Tangible Personal Property] of Part 3;
section 60 [tax if conveyance purchased in British Columbia for interjurisdictional use];
section 66 [adjustment of tax in respect of conveyance];
section 101 [tax on reusable containers],

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a corporation is exempt from tax imposed under any of the following provisions of the Act in respect of tangible personal property if the corporation acquired the tangible personal property from a related corporation:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: Division 4 [Tangible Personal Property Brought into British Columbia] of Part 3;
Division 5 [Property Brought into British Columbia from Outside Canada] of Part 3;
section 63 [tax if conveyance brought into and used in British Columbia];
section 64 [tax if change in use of conveyance acquired for resale];
section 66 [adjustment of tax in respect of conveyance], and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a corporation is exempt from tax imposed under section 100 [tax on gift of vehicle, boat or aircraft given in British Columbia] of the Act in respect of a vehicle, boat or aircraft if the corporation receives the vehicle, boat or aircraft as a gift from a related corporation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The exemptions under subsection (2) (a), (b) and (c) do not apply to a corporation in respect of tangible personal property unless one or more of the following requirements are met:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to subsections (4) to (7), a related corporation of either the corporation or the previous owner of the tangible personal property

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: paid tax under the Act, the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act or the Social Service Tax Act in respect of the tangible personal property and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under those Acts, a refund of that tax, or

paid tax, in respect of the tangible personal property, under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act, in respect of British Columbia as a participating province under Part IX of that Act, and has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain, under Part IX of that Act, a refund of or a credit or rebate for that tax;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the previous owner of the tangible personal property, before July 1, 1948, acquired in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia the tangible personal property;
subject to subsection (8),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the previous owner of the tangible personal property, on or after July 1, 1948 but before July 1, 2010, acquired in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia the tangible personal property, and

the previous owner of the tangible personal property was not subject to, or was exempt from, tax under the Social Service Tax Act in respect of the acquiring in British Columbia, bringing or sending into British Columbia or receiving of delivery in British Columbia of the tangible personal property;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to subsection (9),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the previous owner of the tangible personal property, on or after July 1, 2010 but before April 1, 2013, acquired in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia the tangible personal property, and

the previous owner of the tangible personal property would not have been subject to, or would have been exempt from, tax under the Act in respect of the acquiring in British Columbia, bringing or sending into British Columbia or receiving of delivery in British Columbia of the tangible personal property, if the Act and the regulations made under it, as they read on April 1, 2013, had been in force during the period referred to in subparagraph (i);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to subsection (10),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the previous owner of the tangible personal property, on or after April 1, 2013, acquired in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia the tangible personal property, and

the previous owner of the tangible personal property was not subject to, or was exempt from, tax under the Act in respect of the acquiring in British Columbia, bringing or sending into British Columbia or receiving of delivery in British Columbia of the tangible personal property;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to subsection (11),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the previous owner of the tangible personal property, before April 1, 2013, acquired the tangible personal property outside British Columbia, and
the previous owner of the tangible personal property would have been exempt under this Division from tax imposed under the Act in respect of the tangible personal property if

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the Act and the regulations made under it, as they read on April 1, 2013, had been in force on the date on which the tangible personal property was acquired, and
the previous owner had purchased the tangible personal property at a sale in British Columbia;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to subsection (11),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the previous owner of the tangible personal property, on or after April 1, 2013, acquired the tangible personal property outside British Columbia, and

the previous owner of the tangible personal property would have been exempt under this Division from tax imposed under the Act in respect of the tangible personal property if the previous owner had, on the date on which the tangible personal property was acquired, purchased the tangible personal property at a sale in British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (3) (a) (i),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: tax under the Act does not include tax under the following provisions of the Act:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: Division 3 [Leases of Tangible Personal Property] of Part 3;
section 62 [tax if leased conveyance used in British Columbia];
Division 7 [Multijurisdictional Vehicles] of Part 3;
Division 11 [Energy Products] of Part 3;
section 102 [tax on leased property occasionally supplied with operator], and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: tax under the Social Service Tax Act does not include tax under the following provisions of that Act:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: Division 2 [Tax in relation to Leases] of Part 2;
Division 3 [Tax in relation to Multijurisdictional Vehicles] of Part 2;
Division 9 [Environmental Levies] of Part 2.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The requirement set out in subsection (3) (a) is not met if the related corporation referred to in that subsection

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: paid tax under the Act or the Social Service Tax Act in respect of a portion of the consideration for the tangible personal property,
